intro: Antirrhinum hispanicum var. bolosii, commonly known as the Bolosii snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value and adaptability make it a popular choice among gardeners and botanists alike.
